content: भारत {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (ती|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [भरतस्येदं, भारतान् भरतवंश्य नधिकृत्य कृतो ग्रंथः अण्] Belonging to or descended from Bharata. --तः {@--1@} A descendant of Bharata. {@--2@} An inhabitant of {%Bharatavarṣa%} or India. {@--3@} An actor. {@--4@} An epithet of the sun shining on the south of Meru. --तं {@--1@} India, the country of Bharata; <ls>Śi. 14. 5.</ls> {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of the most celebrated epic poem in Sanskrit which gives the history of the descendants of Bharata with innumerable episodes. (It is attributed to Vyāsa or कृष्णद्वैपायन, but the work, as we have it at present, is evidently the production of many hands); श्रवणांजलिपुटपेयं विरचितवान् भारताख्यममृतं यः . तमहमरागमकृष्णं कृष्णद्वैपायनं वंदे <ls>Ve. 1. 4</ls>; व्यासगिरां निर्यासं सारं विश्वस्य भारतं वंदे . भूषणतयैव संज्ञां यदंकितां भारती वहति .. <ls>Āryā S. 31.</ls> {@--3@} The science of music and dramaturgy founded by Bharata. --ती {@--1@} Speech, voice, words, eloquence; भारतीनिर्घोषः <ls>U. 3</ls>; तमर्थमिव भारत्या सुतया योक्तुमर्हसि <ls>Ku. 6. 79</ls>; नवरसरुचिरां निर्मितिमादधती भारती कवेर्जयति <ls>K. P. 1.</ls> {@--2@} The goddess of speech, Sarasvatī. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a particular kind of style; भारती संस्कृतप्रायो वाग्व्यापारो नटाश्रयः <ls>S. D. 285.</ls> {@--4@} A quail. {@--5@} The dramatic art in general.
